priorVersion.title: CDISC Questionnaire TSCYC Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C147550

self.title: CDISC Questionnaire TSCYC Test Code Terminology

definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children test code.
name: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children Questionnaire Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC Questionnaire TSCYC Test Code Terminology
synonyms: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children Questionnaire Test Code

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Temper tantrums.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Looking sad.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Telling a lie.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Bad dreams or nightmares.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Living in a fantasy world.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Living in a Fantasy World

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Seeming to know more about sex than he or she should.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Seeming to Know More About Sex
synonyms: TSCYC1-Seeming to Know More About Sex

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Being easily scared.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not wanting to go somewhere that reminded him or her of a bad thing from the past.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Not Wanting to Go Somewhere

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Worrying that his or her food was poisoned.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Flinching or jumping when someone moved quickly or there was a loud noise.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Being bothered by memories of something that happened to him or her.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Worrying that someone might be sexual with him or her.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Worrying Someone Might Be Sexual

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not wanting to talk about something that happened to him or her.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not doing something he or she was supposed to do.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Not Do Something Supposed to Do
synonyms: TSCYC1-Not Do Something Supposed to Do

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Breaking things on purpose.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Talking about sexual things.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Having trouble concentrating.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Blaming himself or herself for things that weren't his or her fault.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Blaming for Things Weren't Fault

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Acting frightened when he or she was reminded of something that happened in the past.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Pretending to have sex.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Worrying that bad things would happen in the future.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Worrying Bad Things in Future

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Arguing.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Getting into physical fights.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Drawing pictures about an upsetting thing that happened to him or her.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not noticing what he or she was doing.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Not Noticing What He or She Doing
synonyms: TSCYC1-Not Noticing What He or She Doing

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Having trouble sitting still.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Playing games about something bad that actually happened to him or her in the past.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Playing Games Something Bad Past

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Seeming to be in a daze.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Seeming to Be in a Daze
synonyms: TSCYC1-Seeming to Be in a Daze

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Having trouble remembering an upsetting thing that happened in the past.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Using drugs.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Fear of the dark.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Being afraid to be alone.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Being Afraid to Be Alone

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Spacing out.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Being too aggressive.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often he or she has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Touching other children's or adults' private parts (under or over clothes).

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Suddenly seeing, feeling, or hearing something bad that happened in the past.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Seeing Bad Happened in the Past
synonyms: TSCYC1-Seeing Bad Happened in the Past

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Hearing voices telling him or her to hurt someone.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Hearing Voices to Hurt Someone

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Staring off into space.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Changing the subject or not answering when he or she was asked about a bad thing that happened to him or her.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Changing Subject About Bad Thing

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Having a nervous breakdown.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not laughing or being happy like other children.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Not Happy Like Other Children

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Crying at night because he or she was frightened.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Hitting adults (including parents).
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Being frightened of men.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not being able to pay attention.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Not Being Able to Pay Attention
synonyms: TSCYC1-Not Being Able to Pay Attention

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Seeming to be a million miles away.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Seeming to Be Million Miles Away
synonyms: TSCYC1-Seeming to Be Million Miles Away

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Being easily startled.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Watching out everywhere for possible danger.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Watching Out for Possible Danger

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: No longer doing things that he or she used to enjoy.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - No Longer Doing Things Enjoy

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Becoming frightened or disturbed when something sexual was mentioned or seen.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not sleeping for two or more days.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Not Sleeping for Two or More Days
synonyms: TSCYC1-Not Sleeping for Two or More Days

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not paying attention because he or she was in his or her own world.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Not Paying Attention in Own World
synonyms: TSCYC1-Not Paying Attention in Own World

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Making mistakes.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Crying for no obvious reason.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Crying for No Obvious Reason

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not wanting to be around someone who did something bad to him or her or reminded him or her of something bad.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Not Wanting to Be Around Someone
synonyms: TSCYC1-Not Wanting to Be Around Someone

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Being tense.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Worrying about other people's safety.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Becoming very angry over a little thing.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Very Angry Over a Little Thing
synonyms: TSCYC1-Very Angry Over a Little Thing

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Drawing pictures about sexual things.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Drawing Pictures About Sex Things

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Pulling his or her hair out.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Pulling His or Her Hair Out
synonyms: TSCYC1-Pulling His or Her Hair Out

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Calling himself or herself bad, stupid, or ugly.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Calling Himself or Herself Bad

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Throwing things at friends or family members.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Getting upset about something in the past.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Getting Upset About the Past

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Temporary blindness or paralysis.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Getting upset about something sexual.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not going to bed at night the first time he or she was asked.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Not Going to Bed First Time Asked
synonyms: TSCYC1-Not Going to Bed First Time Asked

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Fear that he or she would be killed by someone.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Fear He or She Killed by Someone
synonyms: TSCYC1-Fear He or She Killed by Someone

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Saying that nobody liked him or her.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Saying Nobody Liked Him or Her
synonyms: TSCYC1-Saying Nobody Liked Him or Her

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Crying when he or she was reminded of something from the past.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Crying When Reminded From Past

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Saying that something bad didn't happen to him or her even though it did happen.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Saying he or she wanted to die or be killed.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Saying He or She Wanted to Die
synonyms: TSCYC1-Saying He or She Wanted to Die

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Acting as if he or she didn't have any feelings about something bad that happened to him or her.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Acting as If Didn't Have Feelings
synonyms: TSCYC1-Acting as If Didn't Have Feelings

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Whining.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not sleeping well.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Worrying about sexual things.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Being frightened by things that didn't used to scare him or her.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Hallucinating.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Acting like he or she was in a trance.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Acting Like He or She Was in Trance
synonyms: TSCYC1-Acting Like He/She Was in Trance

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Forgetting his or her own name.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Forgetting His or Her Own Name
synonyms: TSCYC1-Forgetting His or Her Own Name

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Getting upset when he or she was reminded of something bad that happened.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Upset When Reminded Bad Happened

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Avoiding things that reminded him or her of a bad thing that had happened in the past.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Avoiding Bad Happened in Past

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Acting jumpy.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Making a mess.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Acting sad or depressed.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Being so absent-minded that he or she didn't notice what was going on around him or her.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not wanting to eat certain foods.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Not Wanting to Eat Certain Foods
synonyms: TSCYC1-Not Wanting to Eat Certain Foods

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Yelling at family, friends, or teachers.
terms.preferredTerm: TSCYC - Yelling at Family, Friends or Teachers

terms.definition: Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Not playing because he or she was depressed.
Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Being disobedient.

Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children - Please indicate how often the child has done, felt, or experienced each of the following things in the last month: Intentionally hurting other children or family members.
